intro: Panicum polyanthes, commonly known as the blue panic grass, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its striking blue-gray foliage and delicate, fluffy seed heads. The plant typically grows in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It blooms from late spring to early summer, producing small, pale blue flowers that attract pollinators. Panicum polyanthes is drought-tolerant and requires minimal maintenance once established.
